channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti, 27th August
item.description:
St George Cross graffiti is now all over the borough - reminiscent of national front graffiti and very threatening to many residents due to what this symbolises. Please can this be removed asap??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anchor And Hope Lane, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E bikes, 27th August
item.description:
E bikes has damaged my car , on the 23rd of August 2025 , this is the second time now , and it's so frustrating, it happened on de beauvoir road were they park the bikes, they keep parking the bikes in a bay right were my car is parked, please help me.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Why has Hackney Council left dead bushes and dead palm trees and not cut them down.Trees and bushes pose hazards to members of public,residents.Rats are nesting in the bushes causing rodent nuisance. Someone from the council could do the job properly these are unwanted bushes and trees that have been planted with no permission. This is public land for public residence to use., 26th August
item.description:
Gardening team required maintenance cutting down large dead palm trees and dead bushes Hackney Council leaving them there for a number of years causing issues.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for Pruning â€“ Overgrown Lime Tree Obstructing Driveway, 26th August
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern about the lime tree located on the footpath outside 19 Sandford Road, Bromley - Br2 9AL. The tree has become overgrown and its branches are now obstructing access to our driveway. This makes it difficult to enter and exit safely, particularly with larger vehicles. I kindly request that the council arrange for the tree to be pruned back so that it no longer blocks the driveway. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to hearing when the work might be scheduled.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandford Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Bins Full, 26th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Hole in floor around lampost, 26th August
item.description:
A large hole bigger than a adult foot is surrounding a leaning over lamppost. I have caught my foot in the hole and it nearly snapped my ankle. This is a high risk hazard. The hole needs to be filled and the lamp post straightened as it will lean over more until the hole is filed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Curlew Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
